column4: hi all, i have a small thing with samba, i created a share with samba and no i want to open it on my windows system but it keeps asking me for a username and password, and i dont want that
yu can automount it with username and password remembered
that is not what i want, i want to keep it very simple (since i am the only person using it) i dont want to use a username and pass
hold on i will make a pastbin for you so you will understand it better
do u want to access samba folder without credentials?
nevermind i have solved it allready
no i had to do security = share instead of user that was the trick
now i can access the data on my unbuntu system without credentials (since its my private network)
and because i am lazy offcourse ;)
now i can copy my data, because i want to change from windows media server to ubuntu media server (because i think it will preform even better then my windows system does, with less resources
